channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: House plows ahead on Trump agenda after Johnson strikes deal with GOP rebels who paralyzed House
item.description: House Republicans are advancing two key bills backed by President Donald Trump this week after the chamber was paralyzed the week before.

item.title: Cherry Blossoms and the Festival of Life
item.description: At least once a year, D.C. is a mortality play.

item.title: Don’t Overcomplicate Babymaking
item.description: No normal person has children for the good of the country or to own the libs, nor should they.

item.title: Trump is reportedly planning the military parade he has long wanted for his 79th birthday
item.description: He called for one in his first term, but the price tag was said to be too high at $92 million.

item.title: How State-Sanctioned Donor Doxxing Threatens The Pro-Life Movement
item.description: In many states, legislators have introduced bills to make advocacy organizations disclose their donors; the goal is silencing conservatives.

item.title: Doral is home to one of Trump’s golf clubs. Its mayor is pleading with the president to spare Venezuelan families from deportation: ‘These families do not want handouts’
item.description: Trump has ended two federal programs that allowed more 700,000 Venezuelans to live and work legally in the U.S.

item.title: Poll position: Where Trump stands with Americans 11 weeks into his 2nd White House term
item.description: President Donald Trump's approval ratings in national polls have been edging downward in the 11 weeks since he returned to power in the White House.

item.title: How Tariffs Encourage Waste
item.description: Tariffs channel our energies into avoiding taxes rather than into making things people want.

item.title: Why Transhumanists Like Elon Musk Can Never Be Conservative
item.description: Humanity is so much more than a 'biological bootloader.'

item.title: It’s Okay For Men And Women To Have Different Kinds Of Jobs
item.description: We cannot continue pretending that everyone needs to do everything.
